content.raw:
We just had our first cloudsim connection success, although without braving `tc`.  It took about 10 minutes to build the docker image on the fc. Going back to Aric's earlier note about the realtime factor, I was getting 0.13x -- as measured by comparing `rostopic hz /clock --wall`  against 1kHz.

I just got two machines with dramatically different IPs (`13.56.19.209`and `54.219.161.69`) which makes me wonder, do we know these machines are in the same datacenter? Or is it luck of the draw?

I just got two machines with dramatically different IPs (13.56.19.209and 54.219.161.69) which makes me wonder, do we know these machines are in the same datacenter? Or is it luck of the draw?
